Commencing transport to  [Leujaoam Sanctum/the Mamool Ja Training Grounds/Lebros Cavern/Periqia/Ilrusi Atoll/Nyzul Isle/The Ashu Talif/Zhayolm Remnants/Arrapago Remnants/Bhaflau Remnants/Silver Sea Remnants]!�
Wow! Look at this place!Ooh, what's that?1�
Tell me everything!1�
Hey, now!This is an ancient ruin you have the privilege to be in. Try not to disturb the--1�
This is my first time in an ancient ruin! It's so exciting!1�
Poor old Tateeya is stuck in the factory all by herself!But lucky me gets to go on a field trip with Mister Ghatsad!1�
Well, I'm glad to see you're taking an interest in the past.1�
But if you keep up that ruckus, who knows what sort of unwanted attention you'll attract?1�
Even with us here to protect you, some monster might snatch you away into the shadows.1�
They've even employed mercenaries from Salaheem's Sentinels to patrol the ruins for dangerous beasts.1�
Many alchemists have fallen prey to the legions of foul creatures that stalk these halls.1�
You know how on moonless nights you can hear the roar of the Cyan Deep echoing through the darkness?1�
That sound is really the wails of those lost alchemists as their spirits roam the ruins in despair...1�
Rishfee!1�
That's quite enough. The poor child is shaking in fear.1�
Is that r-really true?1�
Maybe you'll be the first to find out...1�
Y-you're lying!You're just being a big meanie-weanie!1�
Amnaf. What do you see?1�
Quiet...1�
We're not alone...1�
Hey, it's you!What are you doing down here?1�
If you want to see the ruins, you should come along with us!1�
Ah, yes. Your 3���� marks you plainly.1�
Are you taking care of your automaton?1�
Are you here all by yourself?1�
If you want to see the ruins, you should come along with us!1�
Ah, yes. Your 3���� marks you plainly.1�
I'm assuming this is your first visit to the ruins?Perhaps it would benefit you to join our little tour.1�
Mister Ghatsad was about to tell us about the Alzadaal civilization.These ruins have so many stories!1�
Which part of the ruins do you ask about?The windows.The pillars.The floor.1�
You wish to learn about the windows?1�
Look at those fish swimming around in there!I wonder what would happen if the windows broke!1�
Those fish are actually swimming in the waters of the Cyan Deep. We are currently on the bottom of the ocean, looking out at them.1�
Those windows are under an incredible amount of pressure from the weight of the water. If the windows were to break, I'm afraid we'd be crushed in an instant.1�
What is that sparkling light all over the glass?I've never seen anything like it!1�
That is the glow of plasma oil...1�
Ooh, isn't that the same oil we use in the automatons?1�
That's correct.The windows of these ruins are actually membranes of plasma oil that repel the waters of the sea like giant bubbles.1�
You mean it just bounces off?1�
You could put it that way, yes.But these barriers have been in place for hundreds of years. I highly doubt they'll give way any time soon.1�
A truly astonishing feat of technology.1�
However, the only reason these membranes hold is due to a constant supply of plasma oil.1�
Some day, this supply must run out, and when it does...1�
Are y-you trying to scare me too, Mister Ghatsad?I'm not sure I wanna stay here much longer...1�
Ah, you've touched upon an interesting area.1�
But it is not the shape of the pillars that is so fascinating.1�
Any person with a basic knowledge of archaeology would recognize the graceful conical base and frail-looking central column.1�
This design was often seen in the temples built during the reign of Emperor Alzadaal, some 900 years ago.1�
The fascinating thing about these pillars lies in the construction itself.1�
There are markings that suggest a degree of rotation and elongation is possible...1�
Why would they make a pillar like that?1�
Hmm, I wonder the same thing.1�
I theorize that the architects of this structure wanted to incorporate a level of flexibility to compensate for the changes in water pressure...1�
That's pretty clever...1�
Should these technological marvels be understood in the near future, I hope to adapt their use to the field of automaton construction...1�
Mister Ghatsad!1�
I'm gonna work real hard on my studies so I can help you!1�
The floor?Yes, it really is quite fascinating.1�
Ooh, I wanted to hear about this!1�
The elegant mosaics on the floor are designed with several different varieties of stones... One might say that these designs are symbolic of the prosperity of the Alzadaal Dynasty.1�
It's a shame we've lost so many of the arts of that age...1�
What about this shining symbol on the floor over here?1�
I'm sure I've seen this design somewhere before...1�
Dum-dee-dum-dee-dum...1�
That is a transport device not unlike the runic portals currently employed by the Empire.1�
The Aht Urhgan Archaeological Research Institute has deemed these devices safe for use in their continuing investigations.1�
Hmmm...Dum-dee-dum-dee-dum...So they still work even after 900 years?1�
Yes.A curious fact.1�
The A.A.R.I. has been diligent in its efforts to remove all traces of dust and grime as they work through the ruins, but have not attempted any maintenance.1�
There simply hasn't been a need.1�
It's as if these ruins have been frozen in time...1�
Not merely in appearance, but in all of its functions.1�
I love mysteries!1�
I bet the ruins were just waiting for us to rediscover them!1�
You could be right, Abda-Lurabda...1�
I think that's enough for one day.Time to return to the workshop.1�
What? Already?We just got here!1�
We can't have poor Tateeya mind the place all by herself, now can we?1�
I suppose not...But you'll bring me here again, right?1�
I promise.1�
Rishfee, would you mind escorting young Abda-Lurabda back to Al Zahbi?1�
yProceeding with the Aht Urhgan mission ��Path of Darkness�� will prevent you from entering Salaheem's Sentinels until the mission is complete.1�
Do you wish to proceed with the mission?1�
Proceed with the mission?Yes.No.1�
Letting the San d'Orian spy live was the right move, it seems...1�
It has all unfolded just as the Grand Vizier predicted.1�
And so you have come...1�
A pity.I always respected you,  , but such are the twists of fate.1�
The Grand Vizier has decreed that your time on this stage has come to an end.�
Hehehe.1�

One, two, three...at 
 	)�������� per...1�

!This level of assistance just cost ya 
 	)��������!1�
Naja! What is the meaning of this?1�
That's what I'd like to know!1�
This employee still has a pile of tuition fees to pay.If I let �[him/her] come to a messy end here, I'm losin' out on a lot of cash!1�
You worry for a few measly coins?If you stand against me, your entire company is at stake.1�
Ooh, I'm shakin' in my booties.Need I rrremind ya that my company has the personal backing of the Emprrress?1�
Times have changed, foolish Mithra...1�
My help is expensive,  .Better take care of this quickly if ya don't wanna spend the rrrest of your life payin' it off!1�
For the Sentinels!!!�
I will...not...allow...1�
For...the...Gra...nd...Vi...zier...�
I...will...stop...you...1�
For...my...Raz...fahd...<wheeze>...1�
Amnaf.My dear Immortal Lion.1�
Your part in this is over.You have earned eternal rest...1�
Ewww...Now this is an interrrestin' development.1�
My tail is twitchin' all over the place...1�
(Listen up,  . We rrrun in different directions and meet up back at the office...)1�
Now!�
...one day I shall feast on your soul...1�
One day...�
So,  ...This is the path you have chosen?1�
Your decision has been noted...�
Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, �[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.1�
Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?1�
I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.1�
Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.1�

What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Astral Waves.Transformations(pt.1).Transformations(pt.2).Transformations(pt.3).Transformations(pt.4).Path of Darkness.Fangs of the Lion.Nashmeira's Plea(pt.1).Nashmeira's Plea(pt.2).Ragnarok.Forging a New Myth.Waking the Colossus(pt.1).Waking the Colossus(pt.2).Divine Interference(pt.1).Divine Interference(pt.2).From the Ruins(pt.1).From the Ruins(pt.2).Rhapsodies of Vana'diel.1�
Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.1�

Greetings, mercenary.I am 	 of the Immortals.1�
You are here on an Assault mission?Then you'll be wanting command verification.1�
Do you want command verification?Yes.No.I want to ask you some questions.1�

If you have 
� ��[credit/credits] available from your Imperial Standing, I will recognize your ability to lead this Assault mission.1�

Receive command verification?Yes. (
� ��[credit/credits])No.1�
I cannot entrust leadership of a mission to a mercenary with such an unimpressive standing.Return to me when you are worthy.1�
Very well.Consider your command of this mission verified.1�
With this in your possession, you will be able to pass through the runic seal and enter the Assault area.Good luck.1�
You refuse to assume leadership?Perhaps you should make that decision before you speak to me.1�
No?Then I suggest you complete your preparations and await your leader's orders!1�
What do you ask about?Command verification.Nyzul Isle Assault missions.Nyzul Isle Uncharted Region.1�
Receiving command verification will authorize you to begin an Assault mission.1�
You will also be responsible for confirming that all members are prepared to begin the mission.1�
Shouldering this responsibility, and leading your party to victory are all part of being a truly outstanding mercenary.1�

This is the Nyzul Isle staging point.If you have no official business here, it's time for you to leave.1�
You're late, late, late!1�
We've been waiting so long our joints have started to rust!1�
Our preparations are complete.We need only install the 3����, and we can proceed with the activation.1�
How did you fare with Megomak?1�
Yes, this will do.Excellent work,  .1�
We are ready, Your Highness.1�
...Then let us begin.1�
When the 3���� is activated, you must resist the extradimensional intruder with all of your might.Even a weakened colossus in a strictly controlled environment will not go down easily.1�
Still your heart and clear your mind,  .Your humble retainer Gessho stands at your side, ever ready to lay down his life for yours...1�
L-lay down whose life?I thoughtaru we were j-just along for ��obser-wobservation��!1�
<Sigh>... Can you not even show some spine at a time like this?1�
Silence.It begins.1�
Power, check. Spatial variance readings, stable.Activation in three...two...1�
I...am...Alexander.Tremble...before me...Worship...my greatness...�
Those...who fail to worship...�
Shall be...judged...1�

�You are unable to make further progress in Rhapsodies of Vana'diel due to an event occurring in the  [Chains of Promathia/Treasures of Aht Urhgan/Wings of the Goddess/Seekers of Adoulin/Rise of the Zilart] missions.�
Thank goodness you've arrived.1�
This building--and those like it scattered throughout the land--are historic ruins of the great Alzadaal Dynasty, which flourished over 900 years ago.1�
Only under the most special of circumstances are those not from our lands permitted entry.1�
I'm afraid I cannot explain more at present, but this edifice is related to the prime avatar spoken of in Aht Urhganian legends.1�
and I would surely like to hear more about what exactly this prime avatar is.1�
In simple terms...an iron giant.1�
An iron giant!?1�
Its name is Alexander--a being that commands the forces light.1�
Huh?�
How is--�
What on Vana'diel...1�
Ah, Phoenix. Thy voice always grated on mine ears.1�
Oho. But 'twould seem thou art even more cacophonous than usual. Perhaps because now there are two of thee.1�
Ah, so one carrying thy blessing has alighted on this land from the future.1�
I understand thy predicament.1�
If thou dost deem her to be of great importance, then I shall honor thy request to give her form in this world once more.1�
Lady Iroha!�
Master...Sir Tenzen...1�
How do you react?Iroha! Are you...How do you feel?I thought you had been killed!1�
Lady Iroha, your journey to the realm of the living has surely taken its toll. Permit me to explain in your stead.1�
None understand better than I.1�
Phoenix has become whole in the future, and its life force has brought Iroha back to us.1�
Yet this is not the first time, and gods strike me if it is the last.1�
She is stuck within the cycle of life, returning to Vana'diel each time she is struck down.1�
Would that I were not endlessly reliant on my family to rescue me after each mishap...1�
My blade once held power of a similar magnitude, so I am all too familiar with the particulars.1�
Yet just as flame can cauterize a grievous wound, so too are Phoenix's blazing wings of life accompanied by indelible pain. Am I wrong?1�
There is no need to put on a brave front. Though your body may have recovered, your spirit yet needs time to heal.1�
There is naught else for me to do...1�
That girl's presence in this world is forbidden, and is why death doth clamor to claim her at every opportunity.1�
Forbidden...?1�
Doubtless because she has not yet been born.1�
Order must be obeyed, and all that would threaten it shall be expunged.1�
Even Phoenix can only protect her for so long. Its breath draws ever fainter, its energies beginning to wane.1�
I have done what I can, but whether she is long for this world is not something for me to decide.1�

And thou wilt stop at naught to banish the Emptiness.1�

The spirits of eld have surely felt the presence of such an abomination since time immemorial.1�
It surpasses the power of the gods themselves, and shall descend upon Vana'diel ere long.1�
And its underlings have already arrived in our time.1�
Lord Alexander, they aimed to engage in a ritual with the Astral Candescence and use it to steal your power.1�
Ah yes, I recall the Candescence.1�
But thou art slightly mistaken. They were not after my light, but rather Odin's darkness.1�
Of course, it is only via my form that they would be able to summon Odin.1�
But that would call forth �[/ another] Ragnarok!1�
I would relish such a test of wills.1�
�[No!/You can't--!]1�
Fear not, youngling. They scattered as chaff before the wind.1�

...or whether they will search for their darkness elsewhere.1�
Thank goodness you've arrived.1�

Only under the most special of circumstances are those not from our lands permitted entry.1�
Huh?�

What on Vana'diel...1�
